div.b: Muskego-Norway will close its school facilities to students for the duration of the public health emergency. We will continue to provide alternative/virtual learning approaches for the duration of this emergency. Therefore, students will continue their learning from home.
All community events on district grounds and MNSD co-curricular activities (tryouts, competitions, performances, and practices) are canceled.

div.div: Use of arrow keys when focused on the Google language option field will translate site content on the fly. Use your enter key to review all options and choose your selection before applying.

td.p: Click to learn more about school lunch options for the week of April 20- April 24
Click the link above to learn more about school lunch options for the week of April 13- April 17.

p.span: Click to find answers to some of the most commonly asked questions.

td.p: Click to learn more about school lunch options for the week of April 6th. Please note, any child in your household 18 and under is being offered a breakfast and lunch choice each day.
Click to learn more about the lunch options available for students AFTER spring break. Please note, any child in your household 18 and under is being offered a lunch choice each day.

Click to learn more about the updates from Governor Tony Evers, available resources to families, school closure and continuity of learning, technology support during school closure, summer learning academy, meals for children in our community, childcare options, athletics and activities, travel information, medication pick-up, community notification of COVID-19 test results, prevention, and helpful COVID-19 websites.

Click to learn more about the extended school closing date per Governor Evers’s executive order and where to find accurate news from the district during this time.
Click to learn more about all community events on district grounds and MNSD co-curricular activities (tryouts, competitions, performances and practices) being canceled.
Click to learn more about the MNS COVID-19 pandemic plan, school closure decision making, travel information, and prevention.
